page.title: 01BACUP AND STACKSTEADS
page.content: The area (or D-Block) covered in this survey comprises of Stacksteads and much of Bacup, and their environs, which are within the area of North East Lancashire known as Rossendale. Situated on the western side of the Pennines the area has much moorland and the valleys are typified by 'ribbon' development. The population of Stacksteads and Bacup expanded rapidly during the Industrial Revolution and much of the stone built terraced housing remains. Along with other parts of Lancashire this area suffered indusrial depression with the decline of the cotton industry, from which it has never fully recovered. There are no longer any working cotton mills, but many of the factories now accommodate the major industry, the manufacture of shoes and slippers.
